title: House committee debates space mining
summary: A House hearing on space mining turned into a partisan debate about both the viability of the nascent field and the jurisdiction of the committee to examine it.

title: True Anomaly Secures $100M To Expand Space Security Technologies Development
summary: Denver-based startup True Anomaly has successfully raised $100 million in a Series B funding round, marking a significant milestone for the company as it continues its mission to advance space surveillance technology.

title: Air New Zealand To Conduct Starlink Trial In Late 2024
summary: Air New Zealand has announced plans to trial Starlink broadband on domestic flights; positioning itself in the intensifying competition to connect planes using Low Earth Orbit (LEO) services.

title: Voyager Space Announces 2 StarLab Demo Mission With NASA
summary: Voyager Space's StarLab space station has reached two significant milestones as part of its Space Act Agreement with NASA.

title: Can the private sector plug the weather data gap? Space Force to launch new study
summary: The U.S. Space Force will launch a new market research study next year to assess commercial weather services to fill some of the military's ever-growing data needs.

title: Australian space startup Quasar takes aim at U.S. defense market
summary: Quasar Satellite Technologies — a startup that tracks radio-frequency signals emitted by satellites and analyzes the radio chatter to draw insights — is setting sights on the U.S. defense and intelligence market.

title: Cubesat offers template for future  astronomy missions
summary: The first NASA-funded small satellite for exoplanet science is continuing to gather data well beyond its expected lifetime.

title: Air New Zealand to trial Starlink in key year for LEO-enabled plane Wi-Fi
summary: Air New Zealand announced plans Dec. 12 to trial Starlink broadband on domestic flights as competition to connect planes from low Earth orbit prepares to take off next year.

title: NASA's Perseverance Rover Deciphers Ancient History of Martian Lake
summary: Now at 1,000 days on Mars, the mission has traversed an ancient river and lake system, collecting valuable samples along the way.

title: BREAKING! Voyager 1 "Stuck" Not Sending Data Home, Engineers Working Glitch
summary: NASA engineers are working to address a technical issue on Voyager 1, one of the agency's iconic deep space probes, as it encounters communication challenges between its onboard computers.
